Title: Marketing Intern (Brand Strategy & Management)
Required Qualifications:
LA28 Marketing Intern (Brand Strategy & Management)

Overview

LA28 is a non-profit public benefit corporation. The specific purpose of the organization is to improve and enhance the quality of life of the residents of the City of Los Angeles, California, and the surrounding metropolitan area through the hosting of the Olympic and Paralympic Games in Los Angeles. Its core activities include: (1) planning, organization, financing, promotion, sponsorship, hosting and staging the Games, (2) raising funds to be used to plan, organize, finance, promote, sponsor, host or stage the Games, and (3) creating and implementing sustainability and legacy programs for the Games.

Values And Behaviors
Optimism – Embody a positive, enthusiastic, and solution-oriented attitude in everything we do; inspire and support one another to achieve our best; have our eyes on the future and believe we can make a meaningful impact
Integrity – We communicate openly and honestly, listen, and respectfully value multiple perspectives; we do what we say and are accountable for everything we do; we do the right thing, always. Even when it isn't easy
Excellence – We hold ourselves to the highest standard and expectations; we live our values and truths and persevere through challenges; we are continuous learners and adapt and pivot with speed to meet changing needs
Inclusion – We seek to represent, include, empower and level the playing field; our work reflects the communities we serve and the world in which we live; we leverage our platforms to bring awareness to issues relevant to who we are
Co-Creation – We are authors of a shared story. We embrace collaboration within and across teams; everyone contributes their unique voice to our shared mission; we share pride in our accomplishments and ownership of our shortcomings
Boldness – We embrace creativity, courage and outside-the-box thinking; we are unafraid to take risks, explore unconventional solutions, and learn from the process; we are innovators, disruptors, and challengers of the status quo


Marketing Intern (Brand Strategy & Management)

The Brand Strategy and Management (BSM) team stewards the growth and development of the LA28 and Team USA brands and sits at the intersection of a wide range of marketing and organizational projects.

This person will join a highly collaborative and cross-functional team to identify and respond to organizational needs both big and small. LA28 is a growing organization and this hire will be part of building the foundation for the 2028 Olympic and Paralympic Games in Los Angeles.

The ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter, curious/quick learner, strategic thinker and team player – with a genuine interest in the Games, Los Angeles, and people.

Roles And Responsibilities
Support development of marketing strategies, creative briefing/ideation materials, research/educational reference materials that unlock storytelling and brand growth

Help serve as a subject-matter-expert (SME) on young people/audiences/consumers

Other ad-hoc projects as needed in support of brand or business needs


Education & Expectations
Bachelor's degree in progress or recent graduate
Coursework in marketing, communication, sports management, and/or design is ideal
Highly collaborative and works well independently to meet deadlines
Strong analytical/strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
Comfortable finding a path forward in ambiguous situations with guidance
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent administrative and organizational skills

Design skills (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite) and design sensibilities a plus
In-depth knowledge of Los Angeles, sport culture, and athletes a plus


Submission

To Apply Submit
Resume
In lieu of a cover letter, please submit
3 bullet points on why you're a fit for this role
A response to the one of the below questions in 300 words or less (this is required to be considered for the role).

Question (choose One Of The Following Three Questions)
Write about an emerging consumer trend that the Olympics/Paralympics need to leverage.
Describe a threat to the business of sports and how our industry should respond.

Title: Social Media Marketing Intern
Required Qualifications:
The Purpose

Slickdeals is the nation's largest and most trusted deal-sharing community with 11 million unique visitors per month. The community and site are rapidly expanding and Slickdeals is looking for a Social Media Marketing Intern that will play a significant role in growing our social audience and increasing our overall social media engagement. This is a hands-on internship. Our team has been working in digital media for more than 10 years. We come from a variety of companies including Ranker, Newegg, Eastbay/Foot Locker Inc., Demand Media, Reese Witherspoon’s Hello Sunshine, Wonderwall, Cracked and a variety of Los Angeles start-ups – both big and small. We come with a ton of experience and we all really love what we do - we’re eager to share our skills and we take mentoring interns very seriously. We want to see you grow!

To be successful in this role, you should be someone who lives and breathes social media, is well versed and engaged with current social media trends and technologies such as Instagram and Snapcat, as well as emerging platforms like TikTok, Triller, and others. You have working knowledge and an interest in influencer marketing. You should be a creative, out of the box thinker, a risk-taker, have an eye for design with regard to social media photos and videos, and have an appetite for learning new skills. You know what type of content that is best suitable for Instagram and why. You know how to engage with our followers on Twitter and keep them engaged in conversations while also driving traffic back to our site.

The Social Media Marketing Intern will report to the Senior Social Media Manager and will work closely with the Social Media Coordinator and Content Team to socialize brand content, editorial content, and of course, the best deals from Slickdeals.

The Role
Assist the Senior Social Media Manager and Social Media Coordinator with development of social media engagement tactics and execution of social media strategy to help grow Slickdeals’ followers, engagement, and referral traffic to our website.
Work closely with Social Media Coordinator to assist with posting/scheduling of our social media content
You will collaborate with the Content Team to keep an eye on what’s trending and make recommendations for specific editorial content based on observations.
You have creative ideas and love contributing to the team.
Assist with the design of social media images/graphics including infographics and video.
Help identify deals from our website that would be best suited to be shared on social platforms.
Research, identify, and pitch new avenues for social media and influencer marketing.
Support the Senior Social Media Manager in executing influencer marketing campaigns, as needed.
Monitor, listen and respond to users across social media platforms to enhance the customer experience and garner positive brand sentiment.
Get acquainted with social media management platforms and analytics, in order to extrapolate and inform future tactics and strategies.
Track social media engagement to identify high-performing ideas and campaigns for scalability.
Performs other duties as assigned.


The Candidate
Junior or Senior with strong academic standing
Positive attitude and eagerness to learn
Ability to work 20+ hours per week
Team player who shows passion in their work
Critical thinker who can work independently
Creative with an eye and passion for photo/video design
A risk-taker to try new tactics and strategies on social media to drive engagement
You love a challenge and are always looking at what the current winning trends are on social and jump in on those trends


Required Experience
Impeccable oral and written communication skills
Copywriting and editing skills
Experience with social media platforms including Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Snapchat, and TikTok.
Working knowledge of basic photo editing
Experience in Word and Powerpoint
Creativity


Preferred Experience
Knowledge of deal-sharing websites and their social media channels
Knowledge of social media analytics, such as Facebook Insights, to track audience engagement and campaign performance
Experience with image/video editing software/platforms like Canva, Wochit, etc.
Passion for influencer marketing with knowledge of key influential individuals and brands
A Slickdeals user!


$15/hour

We realize our mission of building community through music through two core programs: the permanent Levitt venue program and the Levitt AMP [Your City] Grant Awards, an annual grants competition. In 2019, more than 550 free outdoor Levitt concerts took place in 26 towns and cities across America, bringing joy to more than 750,000 people of all ages and backgrounds. In 2020 and 2021, permanent Levitt venues and Levitt AMP concert sites nationwide have innovated to uplift, connect and inspire their communities in new waysfrom virtual concerts and online songwriting camps to drive-in and pop-up concerts, to a return to in-person live concerts this summer.The Levitt Foundation is committed to equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI) throughout our organization and all aspects of our work, recognizing this commitment as essential to realizing the Levitt mission. We value having a team with a wide range of perspectives, backgrounds, experiences, and skills so our approach to grantmaking is well-rounded and the connection with our team members and the communities we support is authentic. We strive to create a positive working culture through professional development opportunities, employee recognition, and team-building events and activities. We focus on creating a working environment that promotes collaboration and fairness. Our commitment to EDI fosters a culture where team members can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We believe in the value of every individual and encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity. To learn more about the national Levitt network and the Levitt Foundation, visit levitt.org.Application SubmissionEmail cover letter, resume and writing sample tointernsearch@levitt.org, including Levitt Foundation Summer Communications Internship in the subject line.To learn more about the national Levitt Foundation, visitlevitt.org.

Strong proficiency in Excel (including creating Pivot Tables/formulas), Word, and PowerPoint

·  Build media reports to maintain client relationships and expectations
·  Assist account executives with any extraneous tasks, such as updating media contact databases, seeding product to journalists, or researching competitive markets

 Benefits:

·  Small, fun and dynamic family of co-workers

Title: Intern Content Marketing
Required Qualifications:
Intern- Content Marketing

Remote, NE

The time is now to start your next career step at Celonis, one of the fastest growing global tech companies worldwide

Celonis is the execution management system leader. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications, with a developer studio and platform capabilities for business executives and users. The Celonis EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions, and automations. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority.

Celonis has thousands of global customers including ABB, AstraZeneca, Bosch, Coca Cola, Citibank, Dell, GSK, John Deere, L'Oreal, Siemens, Uber, Vodafone, and Whirlpool. All rely on Celonis technology to unlock their full execution capacity and drive change to business processes. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York, US, and has in total 15 offices worldwide.

The company has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. Celonis is continuously expanding, especially in Europe to be able to serve the local markets. Recently offices were opened in Paris, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Madrid, as Center of Excellence for international tech talent. Particularly in these uncertain times Celonis plays an impactful role in helping customers to use their execution capacity the best way possible.



At Celonis, we believe that every company can unlock their full execution capacity - and for that we need you as a Content Marketing Intern.

The Content Marketing team supports the rest of the business by creating exciting and accessible marketing materials designed to hook our audience. The trick? You don't want it to sound like marketing. You want it to sound like the most interesting, in-depth tech journalism out there.

As the Content Marketing intern, you'll get experience writing, editing and proofreading copy for all sorts of formats – from digital ads, to blogs, to videos and interactive experiences. You'll have to dive deep into complex technologies, industries and topics relevant to our audience, researching intellectually meaty topics and breaking them down into simple(r) terms. You'll also get to cut your teeth on the basics of content and digital marketing at a fast-moving start-up – familiarizing yourself with customer journeys, the marketing funnel, content management systems, and other delights.

This is the perfect internship for an enthusiastic writer and editor who's interested in building a career in tech, and who wants to experience life at one of the fastest-growing start-ups in the world.

We're looking for someone proactive, intellectually curious and eager to learn – and who'll send us an interesting cover letter.



You will…

Write compelling and human-sounding copy for a variety of formats
Edit and proofread other people's work to ensure quality and consistency with our brand guidelines
Research topics, personas, industries and technologies, in order to create effective briefs and content that speaks to our audiences
Manage our content management system (CMS) and organize it using tags, folders, etc.
Help out with the day-to-day admin of the team as needed
Have strong communication, project management and relationship management skills

We

... see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. During the quarterly global onboarding week – remotely now – you will receive insights from all departments
... are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the world
… are experts in the field of Process Mining - the new Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications: the EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automations
... distinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible work

Please submit writing samples or a portfolio with application! *

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

 Development:
Assist the development team in advancement of their active projects which are in various stages of development - predevelopment, preconstruction, and construction.
Market reports and trackers for the projects based on their various progress
Assist with neighbour and access agreement negotiations and monitoring.
RFP preparations for various agreements
Assist in community outreach and Community Investment Programs for US development projects.
In connection with the project schedule, coordinate on required design items to advance projects accordingly.
Tasks including requisition preparation and budget management.
Update of paid to date information and analyses required for budgets.

Design:
Support Director of Architecture with the following tasks:
Design standard evolution – R&D and Documentation. Inclusive of unit design, amenity program, operational requirements integration, customer insights documentation and implementation.

Procurement research and database development

Administrative tasks as needed.

Social media efforts: tasks here would include copywriting, scheduling posts, searching for user generated content, responding to enquiries, influencer stay coordination.
Partnerships: research and outreach
Photography: assisting with photoshoots and content curation
Administrative tasks as needed.
 Frequency - part time (2-3x a week)

Investment:

Specific tasks will include the following:
Write and update investment memorandums and presentations for our board, investors, or banks; participate in investment committee discussions.
Perform detailed underwriting and transaction management activities under senior guidance.
Build complex dynamic financial models to analyze land and property investment opportunities (reviewing investment structures and specific assets using financial models and a variety of quantitative analytical tools to test assumptions and sensitivities).

Accounting:
Assist with month-end financial reports.

Reconcile bank transactions.
Assist with setup and data entry for new bookkeeping software.
Prepare recharge invoices for split/reimbursable costs with affiliate entities.
Reconcile balance sheet accounts.
Assist with audits.
 Frequency - part time (2-3x a week)
 Benefits 
•  Regular company events and social gatherings
•  Weekly company brunches (virtual for now!)
•  The chance to be part of an exciting and growing start up!
 Salary: $600/weekly (pro-rated for part time employment)
 How to Apply

We want you to think carefully about how an internship with The Collective aligns with your wider aspirations, and what you hope to achieve at the end of your internship. E-mail your cover letter and resume to Chelsea and Nabila at internships@thecollective.com by April 30th, 2021.

Work with social media manager to execute social strategy

Title: Marketing Internship
Required Qualifications:
We are seeking a smart, entrepreneurial student tasked with helping to bring best in class digital ecommerce marketing skills to an organization on the cusp of large online commerce growth. Each student entering our paid program is connected with an experienced Parker mentor. During the program, students will have the opportunity to work in Parker Chomerics’ state-of-the-art facilities, and gain hands-on experience. This project will introduce the student to the ecommerce sales cycle – from product management to analytics, analysis, strategic pricing, e-commerce and digital marketing techniques. You will work with individuals from across the business, from product managers, to marketing managers, pricing managers, IT managers and many more to determine which products to sell online, how to sell them, what their pricing will be, and finally how the customer’s experience during the buying process will be.
Your project will introduce you to many aspects of the Parker Chomerics business, and will help you leave with strong connections, a completed project and a polished presentation highlighting your results. You will return to school with real-work experience utilizing the tools you learned during your co-op experience.

Performs assignments designed to develop professional work knowledge and abilities that will include cross-functional experience.
Actively acquires on-the-job training and knowledge of marketing principles and techniques required for maintaining Parker brand position, servicing customer relationships, driving strategic pricing initiatives. Assignments are at a professional level but require guidance and direction from more experienced Personnel.
Performs a variety of routine assignments to provide experience and familiarization with the marketing staff, methods, practices, and programs of the company.
Assists team members to accomplish their project assignments by completing specific analysis or well-defined portions of the overall assignments. Learns project management techniques and participates in design or similar program reviews.
Attends internal trainings/meetings and applies in work assignments. Learns to apply methods, measurements, and techniques for continuous improvement and customer marketing.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Work assignments will include cross-functional or project team.
Currently enrolled in, or completed degree in related field, such as: Business, Marketing, Journalism, Finance, Pricing, or Economics. Candidate shall have completed sophomore year with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Ability to work effectively in a variety of environments and assignments.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to work effectively with others and be a participative team member.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.

Founded in 1917, Parker Hannifin Corporation is a $13.7 billion, global company.

With annual sales of $13.7 billion in fiscal year 2020, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 49 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index.

Parker’s engineering expertise and broad range of core technologies uniquely positions the company to solve some of the world’s greatest engineering challenges. By partnering with customers, Parker improves their productivity and profitability and seeks new ways to solve humanity's biggest challenges.

Title: Content Marketing Intern (Remote Opportunity)
Required Qualifications:
Starburst is on a mission to modernize data access & analytics. Our company was founded in an unusual way; with customers and revenue from the beginning! Our growth is already ahead of some of the most successful software start-ups, and we don’t plan on slowing down.

We believe our opportunity is huge. Every large company in the world suffers from a data silo problem. Traditional data warehouse products approach the problem with old solutions that breed inefficiency and ultimately can’t help business analysts run fast analytics on all their data.

Starburst provides a modern solution that addresses these data silo & speed of access problems. Starburst helps enterprises harness the value of open source Trino (formerly PrestoSQL), the fastest distributed query engine available today, by adding the tools and 24x7 support that meet the needs for big data access at scale. Ultimately, Starburst helps organizations run analytics anywhere to make better business decisions.

Starburst is looking for a creative, hardworking, and passionate Content Marketing Intern who wants to learn, contribute, and make an impact at a hyper-growth data and analytics company while having fun along the way. In this role, you’ll help with social media, video content, corporate brand building, short blog posts, and campaign execution. Should have a strong passion for writing, prior experience is preferred but not mandatory.

Responsibilities
Learn and create compelling video content
Help with content focused on corporate brand building, hiring, and awareness
Work on a social media project involving creating and scheduling clever posts on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook, and measuring engagement
Closely collaborate with content, demand gen, event, product, and web teams on campaign execution, nurture emails, community outreach, events, and SEO, as needed
Research thought leadership and technical content ideas and do some light blogging

Requirements
Current enrollment in a related BS or Masters degree
Strong desire to learn along with professional drive
Excellent communication skills with a passion for writing
Motivated team player with a “can-do” attitude and a strong work ethic
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment, prior industry experience a plus
Fundamental understanding of the data and analytics landscape with an interest in emerging technologies
Headquartered in Boston MA with offices in Warsaw and London and employees across Europe and the Americas, we are committed to hiring where the talent is.

Title: Social Media Intern to Hire (Paid)
Required Qualifications:
Who We Are

Since 2009, Single Grain has been dedicated to drive persistent growth for remarkable companies. We've worked with Series A start-ups to tech giants and enterprises, such as Uber, Amazon, and Salesforce. Our expertise is in paid media, paid social, SEO, and content marketing.

We have a blog, two podcasts, and YouTube channel as a testament to our digital marketing expertise. You're exceptionally creative and want to grow
You are tech-savvy, self-starting, resourceful, entrepreneurial, endlessly curious, and highly ambitious
You have effective time management and organization skills, strong communication and interpersonal skills, a positive attitude and a growth mindset
You show up on time, pay attention to details, think on your feet, ask for help when you need it, and consistently demonstrate respect for others

In your cover letter, please include only 3 examples of your most creative social media posts and why you consider them to be your best. Any applicants that do not follow these instructions will be disqualified.

What You Will Be Accountable For

The Social Media Intern at Single Grain will get real hands-on experience creating content from ideation to posting as well as the best marketing strategies to help our content climb the ranks. Write native social copy for Single Grain and Eric Siu’s selected social channels
Huge bonus Chop up all our current content into shorter clips for YouTube Shorts, IG Reels, and TikTok
Help with designing social posts using Adobe Creative Suite and scheduling daily posts across all of Single Grain’s channels
Proactively pitch new engagement ideas and opportunities for partnerships, sponsorships, and advertising to reach new customers and audiences
Continuously monitor the latest trends and changes in the digital publication world to ensure we are always ahead of the curve in our knowledge and capabilities

Prior social media/content marketing experience in school or past internships
Demonstrated interest in digital content marketing
Able to keep up with a fast-paced work environment
Excellent typing, written, and communication skills
Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite a plus (or we will train)


Benefits

Single Grain provides the following benefits below as well as a company culture focused on people and values. We're also on Built In LA's Top Companies to Work for in LA list 2020!
Paid internship ($13/hour)
Growth-oriented culture with emphasis on positive communication, transparency and team building
Employee referral incentive programs
Potential full-time offer with additional benefits at the end of the 90-day internship

Title: Intern: Brand Marketing
Required Qualifications:
Everything we do starts with people.

Our human-centric focus is what makes us different from all other car companies, and it’s at the heart of everything we create. The path you choose today will have a big impact on the future. As an intern, you’ll be immersed in a global organization that currently employs over 40,000 colleagues around the world. If you want to join us in our mission to make people’s lives less complicated, we offer you a chance to grow with talented people who want to make a true difference.

Department & Position Summary

Brand Marketing develops marketing strategies and integrated campaigns that increase brand awareness, improve brand perception, attract new customers, and build loyalty and revenue with Volvo owners. We lead campaign development plans, marketing asset creation, and serve as the integration point across all marketing channels and PR.

As the Brand Marketing Intern, you will be responsible for the following key areas:
Work closely with the Sr. Analyst from our advertising agency of record to assist in coordinating and distributing campaign and evergreen advertising performance reports. This will help our team with learnings that help us determine the effectiveness of our efforts as well as improve for the future. You will be exposed to all of our marketing tactics including spend, target audience, and all current & emerging marketing channels we employ.
Secondarily, help shepherd MY22 change-over creative refresh (excluding launch models) to ensure accurate marketing assets are made available for our partners, regions and retailers to use starting the Fall of 2021. This will entail working with our content team in Sweden to ensure all MY22 assets are made available as well as coordinating any retouching & packaging needed for proper U.S. product specs and usage rights. This will give you some global exposure as well as product knowledge of our line-up and U.S. offering.

Are you up for the challenge?

This is a great opportunity to join a career boosting 10-week program designed around your potential. You will have the opportunity to support different tasks and projects which include weekly learning sessions on various areas in the organization, individual career development supported by your manager and other department team members, out-of-the-office activities as well as fun-competitive events supported by the People Experience team.

Do you want to change the world with us?

We are looking for undergraduates who are full of energy, committed to success and eager to make a difference. We’re looking for team members who have the ability to drive results, has strong work ethic, and shows initiative. You need to be organized, agile, and curious to discover opportunities in a constantly changing business environment.

As an intern, you are results-oriented and committed to go the extra mile. We believe you are a great networker, and communicator. You are a team-player with a positive attitude, interested in developing yourself, others, and our business.

In order to be considered for this program, you need to be currently enrolled in a related Undergraduate degree program as a rising, Junior, Senior or anticipate graduating within the calendar year. Program is set to begin early June 2021.

Title: Marketing Internship 2021
Required Qualifications:
About Understory

Climate change is creating a crisis for the insurance industry and those who rely on it for financial security.
Every year, severe weather causes billions of dollars of damage. Yet traditional insurers lack the tools to accurately assess and price severe weather risk. Without knowing what to expect, insurers expect the worst, leading to unaffordable premiums. For industries such as retail automotive and agriculture, traditional insurance is becoming unattainable. These business owners are at risk of financial devastation whenever a storm strikes.
Understory is the first company to solve the insurance coverage crisis with data-driven insurance for severe weather, starting with hail. Our growing network of ground-based Dot weather sensors, combined with our Atmospheric Intelligence AI, allow us to assess and price any weather risk in the world.
When severe weather strikes, Understory detects it and triggers a fast, predetermined payout. There are no burdensome financial deductibles, and no lengthy claims process. Ultimately, Understory allows capital to quickly flow where it's needed most after a disaster, protecting everything from automobiles to the world's food supply.

Internship Program Details
The Summer Program is a paid, full-time, 13-week internship
Students are expected to intern for 40 hours/week alongside their respective virtual team
Student MUST be available for the entire duration of the program which runs from May 17 - August 13, 2021
Intern Requirements
Working toward a Bachelor's or Master's degree
Be over 18 years of age and able to work in the USA
Bring their student mentality and be willing to learn new skills
Have confident communication skills and enjoy working in a collaborative group setting
Have a solid work ethic and desire to succeed in a fast-paced startup environment
Work well independently and as part of a team working towards a common goal
Be slightly competitive and willing to go the extra mile to get the job done
About The Role

As Understory's summer Marketing Intern, you'll support the company's overall brand marketing efforts and help coordinate new product launches. You'll be fully integrated into our Madison-based marketing team. Our goal is to give you meaningful marketing and professional development experiences and to own projects that will make a real contribution to the company's growth.

Role And Responsibilities
Designing and editing sales and marketing assets in cooperation with internal team and external agencies and freelancers
Conducting and compiling primary and secondary market research to help Understory better understand how to reach and engage with target audiences and key partners
Helping to plan and execute virtual and physical events
Coordinating PR, brand marketing, social media and website development
Conceiving and executing on one 13-week project of your choosing and presenting the final results and deliverables to the broader team
About You
Are currently studying marketing, graphic design, communications or a related field
Have a strong portfolio of work samples (writing, design, research, etc.) which can include coursework and work-related projects
Have an interest in understanding the role insurance will play in solving the financial risks caused by climate change

Title: Digital Event Marketing Intern - TheFutureParty
Required Qualifications:
About Us

NVE is a brand experience and production agency guided by the principle that 'The Right Moment Will Transform Someone Forever.' NVE's team of creatives, strategists and producers develop insight-driven ideas rooted in culture to convert consumer attention into commitment, action, and brand loyalty. With offices in Los Angeles and New York, the agency works with some of the world's most iconic brands through its core in-house departments in addition to the community-based media brand TheFutureParty which was acquired in 2018.

TheFutureParty is a community-based media brand at the intersection of business & culture. We produce micro-events and tailored content for our network of tastemakers and creators in entertainment, music, art, fashion, technology and business. We also have an email that reaches tens of thousands of ambitious creative professionals every day.

About Our Internship Program

Our Summer 2021 internship cycle takes place between April 2021 – July 2021.

This is an unpaid, remote educational internship. Our internship program runs for 12 weeks and provides our interns a hands-on learning experience unparalleled in the classroom. Title: Marketing Intern
Required Qualifications:
Hi, we’re Rheaply!

Over the past year, the world has cultivated a new sense of appreciation for everyday stuff. With global supply chains collapsing and operating budgets shrinking across the board, we have seen the demand for goods and services skyrocket. The obvious solution to being more resourceful and cost-conscious has been to increase the value of everything already around us. At Rheaply, we’re helping organizations do that by developing better inventory management and resource sharing tools. Although rewarding, this problem is not ours alone to solve, which is why we need extraordinary talented people like you to join our team. While we’re also excited to one day meet in person (and hopefully soon!), we are ready to conduct our entire interviewing and onboarding process remotely.

Founded in 2016, Rheaply, Inc. is a Chicago-based technology company focused on solutions for making organizations more efficient, sustainable, and connected. Rheaply has developed and launched the only exchange technology for researchers to share their ideas and surplus resources with colleagues to reduce time, costs, as well as environmental waste. On Rheaply’s Asset Exchange Manager (AxM), users from all departments can access resources and expertise from colleagues in the same organization or beyond. Recently, Rheaply has been featured in The New York Times, Nature, VERGE, and Greenbiz, chosen as a 10 Big Idea in Innovation by Chicago Magazine, a Circular Economy Solver by MIT SOLVE, and received the 2019 Sustainable Procurement Leadership (SPLC) Award for Circular Economy Leadership among other notable awards and recognitions.

Opportunity

As we continue to grow our business, we are seeking a talented, marketing generalist intern to provide support to various functions within the Marketing team. This role will be a 3 month engagement commencing on May 17th, 2021.

In this role, you will curate and create content as well as support events that are relevant to corporate sustainability leaders in supply chain, procurement, sustainability or facilities management roles, but also to everyday people interested in becoming a part of a circular economic movement that will change the way businesses think about their resources and sustainable development goals.

What You’ll Do
Content Creation:
Create at least 1 piece of long-form content (i.e. an ebook or guide)
Create several articles for our blog to drive prospective user engagement
Event Management:
Manage our external events calendar on Wordpress and support with SEO for the Rheaply website
Support in operational activities leading up to launch of external events
Collateral Growth:
Help maintain our go-to-market resource library of content for our prospective users, including case studies, videos, articles, etc.
Support the growing revenue team with collateral for key market verticals & buyer personas

What You’ll Need
Experience with coordinating events & high-level of organizational skill
Experience with crafting compelling content professionally through extracurriculars or professional experience
Research-driven with an enthusiasm for the circular economy and look for ways to explore new content streams to increase inbound leads
A brief portfolio of work to highlight your writing skills & experience

You Will Stand Apart If You Have/are
Currently enrolled or recently completed a higher education program focused on marketing and/or sustainability
A champion of sustainability and the potential of a scaled circular economy
A natural storytelling ability, recognizing not only the importance of sharing stories of sustainable impact but what it means to surrounding people/communities
Experience managing social media for a sustainable brand, circular economy or SaaS-based web application
Self-motivated and organized with sharp project & time management skills.
Critical thinker with problem-solving skills.
Extremely goal-oriented with a positive attitude and high energy.

Are you?
Comfortable in the fast-paced, dynamic environment of Rheaply - hallmarks of a scaling startup
Curious, research focused, ready to learn, and someone who over communicates.
A builder who is able to pivot to the needs of a growing business and culture.
Living Rheaply’s Core Values. (see below)
At Rheaply, we envision a world where all assets and resources are highly visible, searchable, and reusable. Oh, and we love what we do, like, really love what we do. So, join us today to help us achieve our mission!

Rheaply’s Core Values

At Rheaply, we thrive to provide the most seamless experience for our AxM users, enabling our client organizations to achieve full utilization of their assets, thereby reducing costs and waste by keeping valuable resources in circulation. As a team, we pledge to execute our work in accordance with our seven Core Values.
We Listen To and Delight Our Users -- Our users are our most important stakeholders. We strive to provide the most seamless user experience and value to our users across client organizations. We do our best to have empathy for their problems and challenges. We listen to users’ feedback and provide timely responses to questions and needs.
We Encourage Individual Team Member Growth, Innovation, And Happiness -- Our people are our most valuable assets. Rheaply’s success is dependent upon the collective drive, intelligence, curiosities and contributions of all of our team members. We care for the wellbeing of each team member and ensure that they have the support and mentorship they need to succeed at Rheaply and beyond.
We Value Transparency, Humility, and Open Communication -- The key determinant to our successful market execution is our ability to communicate and share successes, learnings, insights, struggles, and solutions across our teams. At Rheaply, we strive to cultivate a culture of intelligence with humility. We care about hearing each member’s voice and understanding his or her unique perspective.
We Care About Our Communities And The Environment -- Rheaply is driven by the mission to reduce our environmental footprint and accelerate our transition to a circular economy. We strive to live by our mission of promoting environmental awareness and waste reduction in our decisions and actions at Rheaply and beyond.
We Promote A Collaborative Culture of Learning and Problem-Solving -- Rheaply is committed to finding straightforward solutions to complex problems. We are constantly learning from each other, from our clients, and from our competitors. We strive to understand problems at the microscopic level and become industry experts in building, deploying, and iterating sustainable, circular solutions.
We Are Tenacious and We Own Our Work -- At Rheaply, we are dedicated to enabling the transition to a more circular world. We are relentless about our mission and vision. We hold ourselves accountable for our words and actions, both internally and in the market.
We Strive To Be Helpful -- We view all the work we do at Rheaply as daily, non-stop efforts to help and support each other, our clients, our users, our partners, and our shared environment.
Rheaply, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of our activities or operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers and vendors, and provision of services. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, clients, interns, volunteers, subcontractors.

Please submit a resume and cover letter (you are welcome to provide a video cover letter instead of a standard letter). Thank you!

Title: Social Media Marketing Intern
Required Qualifications:
Are you interested in a career in Digital Marketing with a focus on Social Media Marketing? Did you know that there are currently 80K open Digital Marketing positions with not enough people to fill these open roles? Did you struggle to land a Summer 2021 internship due to a lack of experience or ability to interview? Want to make sure this doesn’t happen next summer?

The PathMatch Digital Marketing Accelerator is a 12-week training and real-world internship program for college students looking to break into Digital Marketing. This matched internship has a larger emphasis on Social Media Marketing. Students will be focused on both organic and paid social.

Most students don’t realize how critical corporate internships are to landing jobs until it’s too late. Companies use their Digital Marketing Internship programs as an audition process and hire their best performers. But to land these internships, students need the right skills and experience.

But here’s the issue: You don’t learn Digital Marketing or Social Media Marketing skills in a classroom. Companies look for experience working on live campaigns.

The PathMatch Digital Marketing Accelerator is a 12-week program where you'll learn the fundamentals of digital marketing and get matched to an internship with our corporate partner where you’ll gain real-world experience and put your training to use. To find out more: https://www.pathmatch.com/accelerator/digital-marketing

NOTE: Due to the training curriculum and guaranteed internship through our company matching platform, these programs cost students $3,999 (we offer numerous payment options/plans). This is roughly the cost of a course at your university, but far more valuable. You’ll be matched to a paid internship ($15/hr- you'll essentially make most of the program fee back) where you’ll be adding an internship and real-world skills to your resume, setting you up for added success in your next internship/job search. You’ll also build your 2022 Internship/Job Search strategy (companies start their searches in August) which sets you up for greater success.

The deadline to apply is April 16th. Because these internships are guaranteed, spots are filling up quickly.

WHAT YOU GET: 
Curriculum, online seminars, and events
Guaranteed paid internship placement with continuous support from your coaching team
Resume building and career-defining experience that will increase your chances of landing next year's internship/job
Resume, LinkedIn, and interview preparation
Experience that sets you apart from the competition for internships/jobs
Lifetime access to the PathMatch alumni and coaching network

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:
In Weeks 1-6 - You’ll learn the basics of digital marketing strategies, learn marketing analytics to help improve campaign performance, and learn how to build and test content for engagement on social media
In Weeks 7-12, you’ll work in a 6-week internship (possibly longer) with a company where you’ll be able to participate in numerous campaigns and see how campaigns are launched and tested
Build your resume - a Digital Marketing internship will increase your chances of landing another internship/job
Revise your resume, cover letter, and LinkedIn Profile
Develop your 2022 Internship/Job Search strategy
Improve your interview skills with mock interview preparation

Full-time summer availability

Strong work ethic and open to learning

A BIT ABOUT US:
We’re PathMatch. We exist because the outcomes of college graduates over the past 5-10 years have been horrendous. 63% of employers feel that recent college grads are generally unprepared for the workforce. This is due to the fact that students often lack workplace skills and experience built through internships. There’s a growing skills gap and the only way to close it is to help students understand what companies need so they can prepare. Did you know that in 2019, at the height of the market, 53% of college grads were still unemployed 9 months after graduation? We’re working to change this.
 PathMatch offers tools/tech/content to help students increase their odds of landing internships and jobs in the digital economy. Our 12-week Summer Accelerators help students increase their odds of landing future internships and jobs by 86%. PathMatch students make an extra 10K+ in starting salary due to real-world experience.

Title: Marketing & Creative Intern
Required Qualifications:
The CareRev Team is looking to help develop our future marketing and creative leaders! We're looking for a Marketing & Creative Intern interested in getting real-world experience this summer (June x to August x) by shadowing and supporting our marketing and creative teams.

This is a remote, paid ($20/hr) internship only available to students currently enrolled at an accredited college or university. This can be a part-time or full-time position, depending on your availability.

What You'll Do
Work directly with the marketing and creative leaders to craft an internship plan aligned with your goals and interests.
Support a variety of marketing and creative projects that fit your internship plan.
Shadow each team member during internal strategy meetings as well as cross-functional collaborations.
Meet weekly to discuss progress, questions, and feedback on your projects.
Make a final presentation to the team that summarizes your projects, results, and key learnings.


What We're Looking For
A conscientious, self-motivated, and creative individual who values a collaborative team environment and takes ownership of their work.
Must be currently enrolled in a bachelor's program at an accredited college or university studying marketing, design, business, communications/PR, or similar.
Must be located in the US and willing to work remotely.
Previous work experience is a plus but not required.
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) is a plus but not required.
Enjoys a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


About Us

CareRev is a technology company that works with healthcare systems, hospitals, and outpatient centers to create a more flexible, efficient workforce. We help our customers transform their workforce by lowering premium labor costs, filling empty shifts quickly, and building a reliable pool of local professionals through modern, mobile-friendly technology.

When a need arises at a facility, staffing or nursing managers can use CareRev to post open shifts quickly. Healthcare professionals can easily book shifts within minutes through their CareRev mobile app - no middlemen, no paperwork, no hassle.

CareRev is funded by Y Combinator (S16), FundRx (https://fundrx.com/success_stories), Industry Ventures, and an extraordinary group of business angels, including several Y Combinator partners and alumni.

Note: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, CareRev is now 100% remote. We have a small office in Los Angeles (Venice/Mar Vista) open for use by employees, as long as social distance can be ensured.

SENREVE (www.senreve.com) is a direct-to-consumer luxury handbag brand. SENREVE serves the modern professional woman by combining luxury design and quality with versatility and functionality. The company launched in November 2016 and has raised over $23M, with the latest $16.75M Series A round led by Norwest Venture Partners.

Title: 2021 Summer Internship - Creative Intern
Required Qualifications:
Who We Are

We think too much marketing isn't us. It's mass markets not audiences of one. Homogenous groups to be targeted, not individuals to be inspired. Segments to reach, not people with their own ideas and ambitions. It's one size fits all and it's dull.

When it comes to individuals, we're fierce. We stand up for individuality. We speak up against bland, broad-brush generalizations. We fight for solutions that adapt to the individual's needs, beliefs, behaviors and aspirations. And we commit to doing this in every aspect of our work for clients and their consumers.

We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency's vision. And most importantly we value every individual's wellbeing.

We are Fiercely Individual.

As a guiding ethos, RAPP stands up for Individuality. So much so, that it's in our agency value proposition. We're committed to racial justice, equality, representation and unbiased economic opportunity, because we know that the strength of our diversity helps us create our best work. And we believe in harnessing the strength of all our Fiercely Individual people, and the differences among us, because that's the surest way to positively impact our business and network culture.

How We Do It

At RAPP, we are fiercely focused on the individual and how we can create value from every individual's experience with a brand. We do this across three capability areas: customer centric consulting, creativity that inspires action, and customer experience management.

Our data analysts know who that person is. Our strategists understand what they want. And our award-winning Technologists and Creatives know how to get it to them.

RAPP is an integral part of Omnicom's Precision Marketing Group, comprising 4,000 creatives, technologists, strategists, and data and marketing scientists across 40 global markets.

The Internship

Our interns are sharp and can think both strategically and creatively no matter what discipline they're assigned to. During this 10-week program, you will:
Work on day-to-day client business
Participate in an intern team project & pitch presentation
Experience a curriculum of lunch & learns to gain deeper understanding of the agency world

When you are part of the Creative department, you have two main jobs. Come up with cool stuff, and sell that cool stuff.

Copywriter Intern Responsibilities
Use strong ideation and conceptual thinking that aligns with brief.
Present and sell work internally while demonstrating a thoughtful POV.
Execute creative concepts within a team environment (with an art director) for both digital and traditional media channels.
Follow directions and assist the Creative department.
Demonstrate excellence in writing/storytelling and exceptional attention to detail.
Expertise in self-editing and spell checking any grammatical errors.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word is a requirement.
Basic understanding of Acrobat, Keynote and PowerPoint is a plus.
Basic knowledge and awareness for design.
Never leave your art director behind.


Additional Responsibilities
Collaborate and clearly communicate with agency team members across departments and roles.
Bring enthusiasm, open-mindedness, and a professional approach to all tasks and problem-solving.
Be willing to learn and take direction and constructive criticism.
Be ready to give supportive arguments and voice your opinion.
Be proactive, ready to take initiative and able to lead other team members.
Pitch creative project ideas.
Brainstorm and research marketing opportunities for an open-brief creative project.
Be willing to learn RAPP processes and tools to ensure quality control and efficiencies.
Be highly organized and attentive to detail.
Be able to multitask and manage projects as assigned within a given timeline.
Possess a desire to keep up on current cultural trends.
Tackle other assigned duties. Be ready for anything!


Requirements
Applicants must be one of the following:
A current full-time student who is in their junior or senior year
A current full-time graduate student
A recent graduate
Must have a strong interest and/or experience in marketing/advertising.
Must be able to show proof of legal work authorization to participate in a 10-week internship in the United States prior to the start of the internship. Internships will not be sponsored by RAPP.

If so, then please read on.

360Rocks, an impact-driven organization, is currently seeking its very first Digital Marketing Intern to support our small team of two women, Maria Kingery and Mel Hubner. Our purpose, cause and passion is to lead with LOVE and impact the impacters. Through EOS (Entrepreneurial Operating System) implementation and leadership coaching, we help other impact-driven companies crystalize their vision, empower their people and unleash their full potential.

This role has a strong emphasis on producing informative, relevant, and high-quality written and visual content for our current network and prospective clients. The ideal candidate for this position will have a passion for sustainability, be energized by writing short-form and long-form content, and ready to bring in innovative ideas to complement our current marketing strategy.

Specific Roles:
● Content Creation - You’ll get to develop and/or support the creation of original content for our website and blog! Your day-to-day will include maintaining a content schedule, researching content topics, working with Maria and Mel to write content, proofreading, and editing content for keyword targeting/SEO best practices.
● Social Media- You’ll help us boost our social media presence! Our goal is to create an engaged, fun, and educated community. Core responsibilities include maintaining a social media calendar, writing posts, creating supporting graphics, and keeping our digital profiles up to date.
● Email Marketing - You’ll write, design, send, and be accountable for our newsletter, which seeks to educate our network of connectors and prospects. Growth in this area may include involvement in specific email marketing campaigns and automation. Core duties include list building, management, reporting, and content design.
● Design Support - You’ll assist with creating customized presentations, digital content, and sales support materials. Core responsibilities include writing content, creating new brand templates, and following brand guidelines.
● General Support - We’re a very small team at 360Rocks. As a result, you will likely be asked to contribute to tasks and take on responsibilities that are not covered in the list above. We need an adaptable, team player who is willing to support the team and our mission!

Qualifications:
● Passion for sustainability and all things B Corp
● Excellent writing skills. Does writing give you energy? If not, this is not the right position for
you!
● Extremely organized and good analytical skills
● Some experience with digital marketing and graphic design
● A desire to learn more about EOS and working with leadership teams.
● A knack for staying up to date with the latest digital trends, memes, gifs, and social references

Bonus Points:
● Experience with Canva and Mailchimp
● Experience with Copper or any other CRM
● Experience with G Suite, such as Google Docs and Google Slides
● Video editing skills or experience with putting together short videos/animations
● B Corp Assessment knowledge

This is a 10-15hr/week paid internship. The ideal candidate lives in the triangle area in North Carolina, and is willing to work some hours from our office in Raleigh once the pandemic is over. However, we are open to making this a fully-remote internship for the right person.

How to Apply
Please email your resume and cover letter to Mel Hubner at Mel@360Rocks.us
Additionally, please answer the following questions in your email:
- When are you available to start this internship?
- Are you looking for a summer-only internship, or longer term?

We value diversity and inclusion, and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please email Mel at Mel@360Rocks.us. We will review applications as they are received, and look forward to hearing from people interested in having a positive impact in the world.

Title: Summer 2021 Internship: Motley Fool Foundation - Marketing and Communications
Required Qualifications:
Description

Who are we?

We are The Motley Fool, a purpose-driven financial services firm with nearly 30 years of expertise. Our goal is to make the world smarter, happier, and richer by providing outstanding business and investing advice, at scale. But what does that even mean?! It means we’re helping Fools (always with a capital “F”) demystify the world of finance, beat the stock market, and achieve personal wealth and happiness through our investing services, like Stock Advisor and Motley Fool Wealth Management, our portfolio management service.

What does this team do?

The Motley Fool Foundation is a NEW public charity created in January 2020 to coordinate and expand the philanthropic (or, Foolanthropic, if you will!) goals and activities of The Motley Fool. Foolanthropy has been core to the Fool since the days of dial-up internet and boy bands with frosted tips. (That would be 1997, when we launched The Motley Fool Charity Fund, the Internet's first ever group-giving campaign!) Since then, we’ve raised millions of dollars for charity, coordinated thousands of employee volunteer hours, and pioneered Fool School, teaching personal finance and investing basics to the next generation of Fools. Now, The Motley Fool Foundation’s focus is on leveraging our access and relationships in the global investing community to unlock financial freedom for all.

What would you do in this role?

As our Marketing and Communications Intern, you will help our team develop and implement a comprehensive marcom strategy for current and future partners, donors, and stakeholders. You’ll be responsible for helping us tell our story via email, social media, website, and print. We need a strong communicator with exceptional written, verbal, and presentation skills, who can harness the irreverent and imaginative “Foolish” voice to inspire others, even when writing about serious topics like economic empowerment, systemic barriers to financial freedom, and underprivileged communities.

This is a paid, full time (40 hrs/wk) internship from June - August, 2021, that will be fully remote, although our office is just outside Washington, DC, in Alexandria, VA.

But what does this role actually do?
Assist in the creation of branding and communication strategies, including website development and email outreach campaigns, and PR/media list and outreach plan
Conduct market research (including polls, surveys, focus groups and internet stalking) about Motley Fool employees, members, Foundation stakeholders, and strategic communities.
Translate our research findings into key brand messages to be used to support the Foundation’s mission
Track the activities of “complaborators” (potential future competitors/collaborative partners) - organizations already doing great work in our areas of interest. Keep our team in the know by presenting your findings about their mission, programs, and how they communicate with and engage their supporters!
Write compelling, Foolish content for surveys, website, emails and presentations
Keep our website and social media up-to-date with relevant messaging, event information, and donation opportunities
Assist with project management to implement our research and communications strategies - scheduling meetings, tracking milestones, and doing data entry
What do you need to apply?
Creativity. Bring a lot of it, and be hands on with it.
Experience. Must have had hands-on experience (ie internship, summer work) marketing a nonprofit, a major brand, or have worked in a creative agency environment serving either.
Exceptional communications skills. Say it, Write it. Show it. Please submit a writing sample of no more than 500 words about what financial freedom means to you.
You have in-depth knowledge and passion for current trends in digital marketing, brand, brand strategy, and communications and have completed coursework or possess direct, relevant experience.

No Compromise Beauty™

Biossance is a clean beauty brand that uses biotechnology to create skincare products that are effective, sustainable and safe. We formulate with a No Compromise™ approach—proudly blacklisting over 2,000 potentially harmful ingredients. Only the most trustworthy and powerful make our final cut.

Our Story

It all began inside our Berkeley labs in 2003, where through biology and modern technology a plant-derived cure for malaria was created. Since then, over 120 million royalty-free treatments have been given, saving lives and communities. Inspired to keep positively changing the world through biotech, we turned to the ingredients people use on their bodies every day. And we asked how we could do better. Drawing on our rich history of science and sustainability, we create skincare products that are incredibly effective and safe without harming the environment. Because our standards for clean beauty are high—and our standards for ourselves are even higher.

Biossance products are available at Biossance.com and Sephora .

Title: Summer Intern
Company: Children and Screens: Institute of Digital Media and Child Development
Required Qualifications:
Children and Screens: Institute of Digital Media and Child Development is seeking motivated individuals for Spring semester internships. Successful applicants will be majoring in or have a Bachelor's Degree in psychology, neuroscience, communications, public health, journalism, marketing, education, biology, chemistry, or other related fields. The internship lasts for three months and will be completely remote; the Institute offers a small stipend upon completion of the summer internship with a full-time (40 hours per week) commitment. 

Children and Screens has a four-fold mission: to advance and support interdisciplinary scientific research on the impact of digital media on child and adolescent health, development and wellbeing, foster public awareness, promote policy that protects young people and increases the human capital in the field. 

During the global pandemic, Children and Screens is supplementing its existing programming to support researchers, parents, educators, clinicians, public health experts, and others via special COVID-related grants and weekly webinars focused on relevant topics. Interns will also assist the Institute in its regular programs, including an International Congress, interdisciplinary retreats, scientific research and online communication.  

Internships available include:
Research Internships - Among other research-based tasks, research interns will read, critically evaluate, and report on current research in digital media and child development. In addition, interns will research, plan and execute expert convenings and events for various stakeholders, including the public. Applicants should be experienced and responsible consumers of scientific research articles and should have a demonstrated interest in digital media and child development.
Policy Internships - Interns will contribute to research projects to inform policy-makers about digital media and young people. Applicants should have demonstrated interest in public policy, writing and digital media in childhood and adolescence. 
Marketing/Social Media Internships - Interns will contribute to the vibrant programming of the Institute by creating content for social media, expanding its website, and other virtual platforms. Applicants should have experience with marketing, and/or social media management, as well as demonstrated interest in child development.
Video Internships - Interns will contribute to the vibrant programming of the Institute by creating content for social media, its website, and other virtual platforms. Applicants should have experience with video editing and/or video production as well as demonstrated interest in child development.
UX/UI & Interaction Design Internships - Interns will contribute to the vibrant programming of the Institute by creating content for and expanding its website. Applicants should have experience with web design and programming, as well as demonstrated interest in child development.
Graphic Design Internships - Interns will contribute to the vibrant programming of the Institute by creating content for social media, its website, and other virtual platforms. In addition, applicants may be asked to work on projects for print. Applicants should have experience with graphic design on the adobe suite, Figma, and/or Canva, as well as demonstrated interest in child development.

Title: Marketing Intern (Remote)
Required Qualifications:
Badger Maps is a route planning software for field salespeople that dramatically improves operations through route optimization, smart scheduling, CRM integration, and other cool features!

Badger Maps is currently expanding operations rapidly, and we are seeking talented individuals to take part in our Marketing team! The Badger Maps community consists of a group of highly supportive coaches and we value the long-lasting mentorship relationships built within and across our teams. At Badger Maps, you will receive in-depth training and feedback in Marketing within an international environment that will allow you to gain valuable tech-startup experience.

We are looking for an intern available asap, preferably for 6 months. As a Marketing and Copywriting intern at Badger Maps, you will receive in-depth training in the world of marketing within an international tech startup environment. The Marketing and Copywriting internship will provide training in the six major areas that make up the foundation of successful (technical) marketing departments.

Content & Product Marketing

Generate interest in Badger Maps and its product using inbound and content marketing strategies. SEO is the focus of all our content and product marketing activities. Examples of these projects include producing blogs, landing pages, visual assets, podcasts, video, and forum answers.

Demand Generation & Email Marketing

Learn how to generate new leads and build targeted outbound marketing/sales campaigns. This includes communication with potential customers through emails, newsletters, and other channels where you will learn to overcome objections and communicate value.

Conversational Marketing

Utilize our chatbot to gauge user intent of our website visitors. Leverage different conversation playbooks to engage with our visitors and guide them through the buyer's journey.

Social Media Marketing

Promote Badger Maps’ high-impact content on social media accounts including Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin, and Youtube. Use Google Analytics to measure impact.

Competitive Analysis

Gather intelligence on our competitors and map out the market landscape. Gain an understanding of how Badger should respond to dynamically shifting marketplaces.

Marketing Analytics

Work with business intelligence tools like Google Analytics and MixPannel at different stages of the conversion process and measure the effectiveness of our strategies.

What we are looking for
Available asap and preferably for 6 months
Past experience in marketing and copywriting
Excellent written and verbal communication in the English language (fluency in any other language is a bonus!)
Someone who genuinely enjoys to read and write
An individual who understands the tone of voice and can quickly pick up Badger’s
An entrepreneurial spirit that is resourceful and tenacious, eager to pursue own projects, and is broadly interested in different aspects of marketing
Someone who promptly assesses and recognizes valuable information and draws relevant conclusions for Badger Maps
Someone who identifies with our values and is excited to help field salespeople all over the world with our solution.

What we offer in return
It’s an unpaid position.
A chance to make a serious impact and see every aspect of the business.
A trustworthy environment where you get the freedom to pursue your own projects.
A great introduction and training into the world of Marketing and Copywriting.
All you can eat peanut butter, coffee, toast, and avocados.
An international, diverse and great working environment at a tech startup.
A fun environment, with foosball competitions and monthly events.

What are you waiting for? Apply today!

Not convinced yet? Find out more about our company culture and check out our reviews on Glassdoor.

Title: Experiential Marketing Intern- CNET
Required Qualifications:

Typically, RV interns own 1-2 large projects over the summer. With guidance from your manager, you'll develop strategy, pivot, improve, and iterate until finally presenting results to your business team and RV senior leadership at the end of the summer. Our culture is built on feedback, and our Interns are no different. Top-performing interns will be eligible for full-time offers at the end of the summer.

What You'll Do

You'll help execute event tactics such as: partnering with production vendors, analyzing contracts, managing budgets and timelines (as well as other event logistics), defining KPIs, measuring engagement, integrating sponsors, and producing virtual or hybrid (virtual + physical) events for clients, partners, and consumers.

Competency in Google Suite, specifically Google Sheets and Slides; experience creating decks and presentations

Required Qualifications:
The Working Group on Children Recruited by Terrorist and Violent Extremist Groups (CRTG Working Group) is the leading voice on the need for prevention, rehabilitation and reintegration of children exploited by terrorist groups. Our mission is to protect children from terrorist trafficking and to inspire a long-lasting change in the way in which child victims of terrorist violence are treated. The CRTG Working Group seeks a motivated, creative and committed candidate with experience in communications functions, including media relations, content creation, marketing, research and administrative tasks to support our external products. The internship is unpaid. Interns work remotely for a minimum of 15 hours a week under the supervision of a CRTG Working Group staff member. RESPONSIBILITIES

Our interns work as full members of our team, pursue projects that are designed to make a significant difference in the CRTG Working Group mission and purposes and have opportunities to learn about humanitarian, counter-terrorism and security challenges.

• Develop content for web sites and other social media platforms
• Assist with online marketing - LinkedIn, Twitter and other social media platforms
• Identify ways to improve corporate marketing efforts
• Support the development and implementation of larger communication strategies and efforts
• Design and prepare content/copy for corporate briefings, presentations, reports, newsletters, brochures, and other internal and external communications materials
• Supporting event coordination and outreach activities

REQUIREMENTS

• Currently pursuing or recently completed a BA/BS degree in Communications, Journalism, International Relations, Public Administration or related field (Preferred)
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

EXPERIENCE

• Two years (Preferred)

HOW TO APPLY

If you are interested in the CRTG Working Group - Internship Program, please forward your resume and cover note to hr@crtgroup.org. The cover note must include the following:

• Degree Programme
• Graduation Date
• List the communication and marketing skills that you are proficient in
• List your top three areas of interest
• Explain why you are the best candidate for this specific internship
• Explain your interest in the CRTG Working Group Internship Programme
• In your resume, be sure to include all past work experiences and three references

Please submit a portfolio or a link to a portfolio along with your cover note and resume.
Applications will be accepted immediately on a rolling basis. Potential candidates will be contacted by the hiring manager directly for further consideration.
